citation.article-title: Identification of Acetobacter strains isolated from Indonesian sources, and proposals of Acetobacter syzygii sp. nov., Acetobacter cibinongensis sp. nov., and Acetobacter orientalis sp. nov.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Description of Acetobacter cibinongensis sp. nov.
Acetobacter cibinongensis (ci.bi.non'gen.sis. N. L. adj. cibinongensis "of Cibinong" derived from Cibinong, West Java, Indonesia, referring to the place where the strains were isolated)
Cells are Gram-negative rods measuring from 0.5 by 1.0–2.0 μm, and non-motile.
Colonies are circular, convex, glistening, and non-pigmented.

Positive for catalase, oxidation of ethanol to acetic acid, oxidation of acetate and lactate to carbon dioxide and water, growth at 20 to 37°C, at pH 3.5 to 8.0, in the presence of 0.35% acetic acid (pH 3.5), in the presence of 5% D-glucose, and in the presence of 2 to 7% ethanol, production of D-gluconate and 2-keto-D-gluconate from D-glucose, and acid production from D-glucose, ethanol, and n-propanol.
Weakly positive for growth at 42°C, at pHs 3.0 and 9.0, in the presence of 20% D-glucose, and in the presence of 10% ethanol.
Variable for acid production from L-arabinose, D-xylose, D-galactose, and D-mannose.

Negative for oxidase, gelatinase, reduction of nitrate, production of cellulose, water soluble-brown pigment, H2S, indole, ammonia from L-arginine, and γ-pyrones from both D-glucose and D-fructose, production of 5-keto-D-gluconate and 2,5-diketo-D-gluconate from D-glucose, ketogenesis from glycerol, growth in the presence of 30% D-glucose and in the presence of 15% ethanol, and acid production from D-fructose, L-sorbose, D-arabinose, L-rhamnose, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, glycerol, trehalose, sucrose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, raffinose, dulcitol, methanol, and starch.
DNA base composition ranges from 53.8 to 54.5 mol%.
Isolation sources are fruit (mountain soursop) and curd of tofu in Indonesia.
The type strain is 4H-1T (=NRIC 0482T=IFO 16605T=JCM 11196T), and was isolated from mountain soursop (Annona montanae), of which the G+C content is 54.5 mol%.
